trans-unit.source: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to build a .NET MVC Web App that signs users in with both personal Microsoft Account and work or school accounts.
trans-unit.target: How to build a .NET MVC Web App that signs users in with both personal Microsoft Account and work or school accounts.

trans-unit.source: App model v2.0 preview: Add sign-in to an .NET MVC web app
trans-unit.target: App model v2.0 preview: Add sign-in to an .NET MVC web app

trans-unit.source: With the v2.0 app model, you can quickly add authentication to your web apps with support for both personal Microsoft accounts and work or school accounts.
trans-unit.target: With the v2.0 app model, you can quickly add authentication to your web apps with support for both personal Microsoft accounts and work or school accounts.

trans-unit.source: In ASP.NET web apps, you can accomplish this using Microsoft's OWIN middleware included in .NET Framework 4.5.
trans-unit.target: In ASP.NET web apps, you can accomplish this using Microsoft's OWIN middleware included in .NET Framework 4.5.

trans-unit.source: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.
trans-unit.target: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the [Azure Active Directory Developer Guide](active-directory-developers-guide.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the [Azure Active Directory Developer Guide](active-directory-developers-guide.md).

trans-unit.source: Here we'll use OWIN to:
trans-unit.target: Here we'll use OWIN to:

trans-unit.source: Sign the user into the app using Azure AD and the v2.0 app model.
trans-unit.target: Sign the user into the app using Azure AD and the v2.0 app model.

trans-unit.source: Display some information about the user.
trans-unit.target: Display some information about the user.

trans-unit.source: Sign the user out of the app.
trans-unit.target: Sign the user out of the app.

trans-unit.source: In order to do this, you'll need to:
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, you'll need to:

trans-unit.source: Register an app.
trans-unit.target: Register an app.

trans-unit.source: Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Use OWIN to issue sign-in and sign-out requests to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Use OWIN to issue sign-in and sign-out requests to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Print out data about the user.
trans-unit.target: Print out data about the user.

trans-unit.source: The code for this tutorial is maintained [on GitHub](https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebApp-OpenIdConnect-DotNet).
trans-unit.target: The code for this tutorial is maintained [on GitHub](https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebApp-OpenIdConnect-DotNet).

trans-unit.source: To follow along, you can [download the app's skeleton as a .zip](https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebApp-OpenIdConnect-DotNet/archive/skeleton.zip) or clone the skeleton:
trans-unit.target: To follow along, you can [download the app's skeleton as a .zip](https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebApp-OpenIdConnect-DotNet/archive/skeleton.zip) or clone the skeleton:

trans-unit.source: The completed app is provided at the end of this tutorial as well.
trans-unit.target: The completed app is provided at the end of this tutorial as well.

trans-unit.source: 1. Register an App
trans-unit.target: 1. Register an App

trans-unit.source: Create a new app at [apps.dev.microsoft.com](https://apps.dev.microsoft.com), or follow these [detailed steps](active-directory-v2-app-registration.md).
trans-unit.target: Create a new app at [apps.dev.microsoft.com](https://apps.dev.microsoft.com), or follow these [detailed steps](active-directory-v2-app-registration.md).

trans-unit.source: Make sure to:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to:

trans-unit.source: Copy down the **Application Id** assigned to your app, you'll need it soon.
trans-unit.target: Copy down the **Application Id** assigned to your app, you'll need it soon.

trans-unit.source: Add the **Web** platform for your app.
trans-unit.target: Add the **Web** platform for your app.

trans-unit.source: Enter the correct **Redirect URI**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the correct **Redirect URI**.

trans-unit.source: The redirect uri indicates to Azure AD where authentication responses should be directed - the default for this tutorial is `https://localhost:44326/`.
trans-unit.target: The redirect uri indicates to Azure AD where authentication responses should be directed - the default for this tutorial is `https://localhost:44326/`.

trans-unit.source: 2. Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline
trans-unit.target: 2. Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline

trans-unit.source: Here, we'll configure the OWIN middleware to use the OpenID Connect authentication protocol.
trans-unit.target: Here, we'll configure the OWIN middleware to use the OpenID Connect authentication protocol.

trans-unit.source: OWIN will be used to issue sign-in and sign-out requests, manage the user's session, and get information about the user, amongst other things.
trans-unit.target: OWIN will be used to issue sign-in and sign-out requests, manage the user's session, and get information about the user, amongst other things.

trans-unit.source: To begin, open the `web.config` file in the root of the project, and enter your app's configuration values in the `<appSettings>` section.
trans-unit.target: To begin, open the `web.config` file in the root of the project, and enter your app's configuration values in the `<appSettings>` section.

trans-unit.source: The `ida:ClientId` is the **Application Id** assigned to your app in the registration portal.
trans-unit.target: The `ida:ClientId` is the **Application Id** assigned to your app in the registration portal.

trans-unit.source: The `ida:RedirectUri` is the **Redirect Uri** you entered in the portal.
trans-unit.target: The `ida:RedirectUri` is the **Redirect Uri** you entered in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Next, add the OWIN middleware NuGet packages to the project using the Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: Next, add the OWIN middleware NuGet packages to the project using the Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Add an "OWIN Startup Class" to the project called `Startup.cs` Right click on the project --> **Add** --> **New Item** --> Search for "OWIN".
trans-unit.target: Add an "OWIN Startup Class" to the project called `Startup.cs` Right click on the project --> **Add** --> **New Item** --> Search for "OWIN".

trans-unit.source: The OWIN middleware will invoke the `Configuration(...)` method when your app starts.
trans-unit.target: The OWIN middleware will invoke the `Configuration(...)` method when your app starts.

trans-unit.source: Change the class declaration to `public partial class Startup` - we've already implemented part of this class for you in another file.
trans-unit.target: Change the class declaration to `public partial class Startup` - we've already implemented part of this class for you in another file.

trans-unit.source: In the `Configuration(...)` method, make a call to ConfigureAuth(...) to set up authentication for your web app
trans-unit.target: In the `Configuration(...)` method, make a call to ConfigureAuth(...) to set up authentication for your web app

trans-unit.source: Open the file `App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs` and implement the `ConfigureAuth(...)` method.
trans-unit.target: Open the file `App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs` and implement the `ConfigureAuth(...)` method.

trans-unit.source: The parameters you provide in `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions` will serve as coordinates for your app to communicate with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The parameters you provide in `OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions` will serve as coordinates for your app to communicate with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: You'll also need to set up Cookie Authentication - the OpenID Connect middleware uses cookies underneath the covers.
trans-unit.target: You'll also need to set up Cookie Authentication - the OpenID Connect middleware uses cookies underneath the covers.

trans-unit.source: 3. Use OWIN to issue sign-in and sign-out requests to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: 3. Use OWIN to issue sign-in and sign-out requests to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Your app is now properly configured to communicate with the v2.0 endpoint using the OpenID Connect authentication protocol.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now properly configured to communicate with the v2.0 endpoint using the OpenID Connect authentication protocol.

trans-unit.source: OWIN has taken care of all of the ugly details of crafting authentication messages, validating tokens from Azure AD, and maintaining user session.
trans-unit.target: OWIN has taken care of all of the ugly details of crafting authentication messages, validating tokens from Azure AD, and maintaining user session.

trans-unit.source: All that remains is to give your users a way to sign in and sign out.
trans-unit.target: All that remains is to give your users a way to sign in and sign out.

trans-unit.source: You can use authorize tags in your controllers to require that user signs in before accessing a certain page.
trans-unit.target: You can use authorize tags in your controllers to require that user signs in before accessing a certain page.

trans-unit.source: Open `Controllers\HomeController.cs`, and add the `[Authorize]` tag to the About controller.
trans-unit.target: Open `Controllers\HomeController.cs`, and add the `[Authorize]` tag to the About controller.

trans-unit.source: You can also use OWIN to directly issue authentication requests from within your code.
trans-unit.target: You can also use OWIN to directly issue authentication requests from within your code.

trans-unit.source: Open `Controllers\AccountController.cs`.
trans-unit.target: Open `Controllers\AccountController.cs`.

trans-unit.source: In the SignIn() and SignOut() actions, issue OpenID Connect challenge and sign-out requests, respectively.
trans-unit.target: In the SignIn() and SignOut() actions, issue OpenID Connect challenge and sign-out requests, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Now, open `Views\Shared\_LoginPartial.cshtml`.
trans-unit.target: Now, open `Views\Shared\_LoginPartial.cshtml`.

trans-unit.source: This is where you'll show the user your app's sign-in and sign-out links, and print out the user's name in a view.
trans-unit.target: This is where you'll show the user your app's sign-in and sign-out links, and print out the user's name in a view.

trans-unit.source: 4. Display user information
trans-unit.target: 4. Display user information

trans-unit.source: When authenticating users with OpenID Connect, the v2.0 endpoint returns an id_token to the app that contains [claims](active-directory-v2-tokens.md#id_tokens), or assertions about the user.
trans-unit.target: When authenticating users with OpenID Connect, the v2.0 endpoint returns an id_token to the app that contains [claims](active-directory-v2-tokens.md#id_tokens), or assertions about the user.

trans-unit.source: You can use these claims to personalize your app:
trans-unit.target: You can use these claims to personalize your app:

trans-unit.source: Open the `Controllers\HomeController.cs` file.
trans-unit.target: Open the `Controllers\HomeController.cs` file.

trans-unit.source: You can access the user's claims in your controllers via the `ClaimsPrincipal.Current` security principal object.
trans-unit.target: You can access the user's claims in your controllers via the `ClaimsPrincipal.Current` security principal object.

trans-unit.source: Finally, build and run your app!
trans-unit.target: Finally, build and run your app!

trans-unit.source: Sign in with either a personal Microsoft Account or a work or school account, and notice how the user's identity is reflected in the top navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: Sign in with either a personal Microsoft Account or a work or school account, and notice how the user's identity is reflected in the top navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: You now have a web app secured using industry standard protocols that can authenticate users with both their personal and work/school accounts.
trans-unit.target: You now have a web app secured using industry standard protocols that can authenticate users with both their personal and work/school accounts.
